Sample.Title: A549 1

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: A549 21

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: A549 80

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: A549 139

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: A549 198

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: A549 257

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: A549 316

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: A549 375

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: Calu 1145

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: Calu 1204

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: Calu 1243

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: Calu 1302

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: Calu 1341

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: Calu 1400

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: Calu 1439

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H1299 796

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H1299 855

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H1299 894

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H1299 953

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H1299 992

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H1299 1051

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H1299 1090

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H460 438

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H460 497

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H460 556

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H460 615

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H460 654

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H460 713

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Sample.Data-Processing: Basecalling performed using Real-Time Analysis (RTA) version 2.0 Fluidigm mRNA Sequencing High Throughput Demultiplexer Script (https://www.fluidigm.com/software) and Geneious Prime 2019.2.1 (https://www.geneious.com) were used to demultiplex. BBDuk Trimmer (a part of Bestus Bioinformatics Tools; RRID:SCR_016968) was used for quality trimming. HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

HISAT2 (RRID:SCR_015530) was used for read mapping to align processed reads to human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH). FeatureCounts (A part of Subread; RRID:SCR_009803) was used to count aligned reads per gene. Genome_build: Human reference genome (GRCh38.p13; NIH) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Fastq containing 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq reads at single-end read

Sample.Title: H460 772

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Upon purchase, cells were stored at -80ºC freezer and then thawed just before directly loading to C1 HT mRNA-seq IFCs.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Individual cells were captured in chambers of Fluidigm HT mRNA-seq IFC. Total RNA extraction and preamplification of synthesized cDNAs were performed in Fluidigm C1 systems using the script of 'mRNA Seq HT:RT & Amp (1912x)’. A total of 1,600 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraires (400 libraries per cell line) were constructed using Nextera XT index Kit v2 Set A/B and Nextera XT DNA library preparation kits. 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq using Fluidigm C1 system

Series.Title: Single-cell RNA sequencing for the identification of early-stage lung cancer biomarkers from circulating blood
Series.Summary: To develop biomarkers for diagnosis of early-stage lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) patients, we set up single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) pipeline using Fluidigm C1 systems. Through the scRNA-seq pipeline, we clustered 1,441 single cells from four non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) cell lines (A549, H460, H1299 and Calu3) into four groups based on differential gene expression and detected over 2,400 differentially expressed genes (DEGs) from a comparison of four clusters following dimension reduction. We validated fold change values of 120 DEGs selected from three cluster comparisons (top 20 up- and top 20 down-regulated genes per cluster comparison) using qRT-PCR approach. We performed further quantitative validation of chemokine genes (CXCL1 and CXCL2 with corresponding receptor, CXCR2) at mRNA level in tumour and tumour-adjacent normal lung tissues of LUAD patients (16 female and 19 male). Next, we profiled microRNAs epigenetically regulating expression of those chemokine genes in the tumour and normal tissues as well as blood (plasma) samples from corresponding LUAD patients. Finally, we identified relatively high copy number of miR-532-5p regulating those chemokine genes in patient plasma samples.
Series.Overall-Design: We loaded 400 single cells per NSCLC cell lines (A549, H460, H1299 and Calu3) to chambers of high-throughput (HT) scRNA-seq integrated fluidics circuits (IFCs). We generated four hundreds of 3'-end enriched scRNA-seq libraries per NSCLC cell line using in Fluidigm C1 systems (1,600 libraries in total). Those libraries were sequenced using illumina Nextseq 500 systems.
Series.Type: Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing
